result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquis L Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marquis L Thomas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marquis L Thomas was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision fees from CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

- Participate in any Anger Management courses and cooperate fully.
- Participate in Parenting Classes.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquis L Thomas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 8/10/15 ck #335135 was returned by USPS unable to forward.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 6 MONTHS with the following conditions as to probation:
*  Pay all mandatory costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision fees from bail on deposit, if any,  with the balance of bail shall be returned to the remitter. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Participate in any anger management courses and cooperte fully.
*  Participate in Parenting Clases.

Defendant Marquis L Thomas in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.   Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State Court DISMISSED Count 1.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Marquis L Thomas in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered stayed warrant lifted.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next scheduled court date.
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 37.

Status conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquis L Thomas in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. State needs additional time to confer with charging Assistant District Attorney.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the remainder of the bail ($700.00) shall be returned to the remitter.

Defendant Marquis L Thomas in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/10/15 @ 1:30 pm
